Where are the Verus testnet files stored on my computer, and how do I launch the Verus testnet?

The Verus testnet files are stored in different locations depending on your operating system.

**On MacOS:**
The Verus testnet files are stored in the following locations:
```
⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/VRSCTEST
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩⁨/VerusTest
```
Replace `{YourUserName}` with your actual username on your Mac.

**On Windows:**
The Verus testnet files are stored in the following locations:
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
"%APPDATA%"\VerusTest
```
`%APPDATA%` is an environment variable that points to the Application Data folder on your Windows system.

**Launching the Verus Testnet:**
To launch the Verus testnet, you need to run the following command in your terminal or command prompt:
```
./verusd -chain=VRSCTEST
```
This command will start the Verus testnet daemon, allowing you to interact with the testnet.
